text: “ The Thursday Murder Club” is the movie about four friends in a retirement home that decide to try to solve unsolve murderers For fun. This movie is based on a Richard Osmond’s best seller and the adaptation of this bestseller. Ultimately these four friends while having fun trying to solve unsolvable murders become entangled in an active case. The movie is basically a comedy with this a little twist of suspense and drama. I highly recommend this film for adult age people very good

I don't understand how you can cast such accomplished actors and produce such a bad film. Ben Kingsley and Pierce Brosnan are merely background actors and they say dialogues as if they were reading from a prompt.
Comfort film… As far as a murder mystery can be anyway. Cast was phenomenal. Story was entertaining. Only complaint is that it was too short.  Would love to see TMC back to work.
Loved it and also I watched it on a thursday

I am a tough critic. Generally with strong opinions, besides a background of education and experience, I particularly have a background in acting and in film. I (and my partner, also of elite experience) loved this film. Great cast, wonderfully directed, and filmed. Basically, just Delightful! Is it perfect? No. Will it go down as a top all time movie? No. Therefore it cannot get a total 5 stars from me. But it is a total delight.
Brosnan is good, but he is the weakest of the leads. Mirren is slumming a bit through first half (yet still very good), but locks in by the end. Pryce, Kingsley, Imrie (who is working very hard to be on equal footing with her genius co-stars), Ackie, Tennant, Bell, are most excellent. Mays is perfect stereotype schlump cop, without stealing or over hamming. All in such total teamwork, as the best of British acting often is.
Set design and camera work are so subtly 'right on'. The script is 'light', yet wonderfully playful, and twisted in a delightful and intriguing way. A most subtle intelligence to it, and novel's translation to film. So many murders, so many characters, so much history, intertwined.
I do love a good English murder mystery and this one I truly enjoyed
A great cast. The story line was a bit drawn out in spots. Overall not a bad film.

The Thursday Murder Club emerges as a surprisingly refined cinematic adaptation of an already impeccable novel. The work carried out by the director shines with precision, coherence, and a keen sense of rhythm: every stylistic choice preserves the narrative elegance of Richard Osman’s book, translating it into images that remain faithful to its original identity.

The cast delivers a high-level ensemble performance. Mirren, Brosnan, Kingsley, and Imrie clearly enjoy bringing to life characters who, despite being caught in the midst of a mystery, never lose their humanity, wit, or depth. Their interpretations go beyond simply replicating the literary counterparts: they amplify and enrich them, making each one instantly recognizable and irresistibly engaging.

The direction crafts an atmosphere that feels warm and intimate without sacrificing the thrill of investigation. The result is an intelligently entertaining film, offering two hours of genuine immersion in a story that is original, well-paced, and surprisingly moving.

A faithful, respectful, and thoroughly worthy adaptation of its source material.
A film that deserves attention and proves that even an apparently lighthearted mystery can become quality cinema.

My compliments. 💯🔝
Star actors with a lousy script

Finally, a movie that is just simple and enjoyable. "The Thursday Murder Club" is a breath of fresh air in an endless sea of films that can't live up to their own hype, or that just reek of desperation to win an Oscar.

This is a simple movie with a simple script. I've read that it's not very faithful to the book, but as someone who hasn't read it, I found it entertaining enough. The cast (Helen Mirren, Pierce Brosnan, Ben Kingsley, and Celia Imrie) is marvelous, and they embody their characters perfectly. It's just a fun, enjoyable watch.

Osman’s books about this group are some of my favorite books! But it is because of the relationships between the characters that I love them. The crime solving is an amusement. This clearly should be a series!!!! Each of his books could be a 6 part series where those relationships could grow and bring people in. I love The Thursday Murder Club, but, alas, I did not love this movie.

A really boring and eye rolling experience.  Basically a two hour episode of Hetty Wainthropp except Hetty Wainthropp is actually good. Disappointing performance from Helen Mirren. They could have at least used a filter as everyone looked like dried up raisins. Its meant to be Hollywood after all. I wouldn't waste your time on this flick.

The casual sleuthing of four retirees has its stakes heightened when they find themselves in the thick of a real murder case. It’s not the whodunit plot that engages the audience, however, so much as the performances and magnetism of screen stalwarts such as Helen Mirron and Pearce Bronson.
An ok watch but wish they would have kept the storyline more closely to the book which is much better.
A fun, no stress little whodunnit that reminds me of a Saturday matinee my parents might have taken me to.

I haven’t read the book, so I can’t say, how true to the source material this movie is. 

Celia Imrie as Joyce is hilarious and steals the show from the other superb actors.

Stelar cast, even the supporting roles are cast with greats like Jonathan Price or Richard E. Grant, good direction by Chris Columbus and the plot invites also the audience to solve the mystery and speculate about the suspects.

Nice, feel good mystery movie.

Should have been a series.  With a superb source ok and incredible actors it was diluted and contorted into far less than it cd have, should have been. I pray that Osmand's next four books will  be cast with the same actors with consistent attention to the content and characters in the books. To the director Chris Columbus: What happened??

Thank god they made a film because I really didn't like the book.  This is funny, charming, light hearted and a pleasure to watch.  Although, for some reason, they have given Pierce Brosnan an accent which was a bad move as he is so terrible at accents!  But, everyone else is brilliant and the story has been brought to life well.

It could have been so much more. The book is such incredible source material but somehow this star packed cast didn’t deliver the magic of the book. The major deviation from the book at the end was huge detractor and have major implications for any sequels.

In fear of repeating probably what a lot of others have said, (and a common book reader fault), 

They took a book that was short and concise and somehow they changed the characters, behaviors and scenes to something that makes absolutely no sense. 

I think the book read pretty much like a movie and if they went ahead and stick with it they would have made a movie that both the people that read the books would love and those that didn't. 

Unfortunately now the characters felt flat. Even the main characters felt like they didn't have a life before they started solving murders. There are characters in the movie that were changed entirely to represent something ... weird that probably was an addition of someone that wanted to make their own impression on this story. 

Pity. Good book ( i know i know) bad movie.
